result.execSummary:
The defendant Roderick L. WARD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC with intent to deliver (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.
Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of probation, have no dirty UA's and no possession of any drugs.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 2, possess THC with intent to deliver.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 3.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 08-24-15 at 11:30 a.m.
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 7-29-2015 at 9:30 a.m., Br. 1
Plea Date on 7-29-2015 at 9:30 a.m., Br. 1

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminaqry Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-23-15 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.
Joseph Pozorski III, through Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-05-15 at 2:15 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of deliver THC and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-20-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
